summary: This document is an email chain regarding a request to overnight security cameras for the MCC New York project, involving a SigNet Technologies program manager and a DOJ communication technician. It reveals procurement activity for the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

events.title: Camera Procurement Request for MCC New York
events.description: A DOJ communication technician at MCC New York requested to overnight security cameras (20 dome IP, 5 180-degree IP, 2 PTZ dome IP) from SigNet Technologies for a mock-up before project start.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
keyFacts: The email discusses procurement of security cameras for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in March 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York from July 2019 until his death in August 2019.
The request was for 20 dome IP cameras, 5 180-degree IP cameras, and 2 PTZ dome IP cameras to be overnighted for a mock-up.
The correspondence involves DOJ staff at MCC New York and a contractor, SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions.
This document shows facility preparation or security upgrades at MCC New York several months before Epstein's incarceration there.
